title: Capulin Volcano National Monument: Plan Your Visit
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit           Plan Your Visit       No matter what the season, a visit to Capulin Volcano National Monument will be enhanced by planning. Below you will find links to aid you in planning your trip.         Directions Capulin Volcano National Monument is located on State Highway 325, 3 miles from U.S. Highway 64/87.         Fees and Passes All park visitors are required to pay an entry fee or show a pass in the Visitor Center.         Operating Hours and Seasons Capulin Volcano is open year-round. Closing only for Thanksgiving, Christmas, and New Year's Day.         Oversized Vehicle Information Learn about large vehicle restrictions and one-way traffic control procedures.         Pets Pets are prohibited in buildings and on trails other than the Nature Trail adjacent to the Visitor Center. In areas where pets are allowed, they must be on a leash.         Coming Soon Special Use Permit Learn about one-time permits for special events, weddings, and filming.           Social Media Follow us on Facebook, Twitter, and more.         Things to do Find out what activities are available to you, from hiking to hummingbird banding.         Weather and Climate Learn about seasonal weather conditions that may impact your visit.         Your Safety Your safety is your responsibility. Learn how you can better prepare for your visit.
